data.title: Two zero two four
data.solution:
english_digits = ['Zero', 'One', 'Two', 'Three', 'Four',
    'Five', 'Six', 'Seven', 'Eight', 'Nine']

digits = input()

splitted_digits = []
prev = None
for c in digits:
    if prev is None:
        prev = c
    elif c == prev[-1]:
        prev += c
    else:
        splitted_digits += prev,
        prev = c
splitted_digits += prev,

answer = []
for group in splitted_digits:
    if len(group) == 1:
        answer += english_digits[int(group)],
    else:
        group_length = english_digits[int(len(group))]
        answer += group_length,
        
        repeated_digit = english_digits[int(group[0])]
        repeated_digit += 'es' if repeated_digit == 'Six' else 's'
        answer += repeated_digit,

print(*answer)
data.statement:
As the input, you have a series of decimal digits. You need to convert digits to english words after applying RLE (run-length encoding) on the origin series.

For example:

Input: `2009`
After Run Length Encoding: `2 (2)0 9`
After converting encoded series to english words (Output): `Two Two Zeros Nine`

testCases.testOut: Four Sixes Two Ones Two Nines

testCases.title: Test 6
testCases.testOut: One Two One Two Five Ones

testCases.title: Validator 6
testCases.testOut: Six Seven Six Eight Five Sixes

testCases.title: Test 7
testCases.testOut: One Two Fours Nine Threes Two Twos Four Nine Five Seven Zero Six Sixes

testCases.title: Validator 7
testCases.testOut: Zero One Two Zeros Three Ones Two Three Four Twos Five Threes Four Five Six Fours Seven Fives Six Seven Eight Sixes Nine Sevens Eight Nine Two Eights Two Nines

data.constraints:
No one digit repeats more than 9 times in a row in the input.
[[Length of the input string]] < 60
data.inputDescription: <<Line 1:>> The string containing decimal digits only.
data.outputDescription: <<Line 1:>> The string of space separated words.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

As the input, you have a series of decimal digits. You need to convert digits to english words after applying RLE (run-length encoding) on the origin series.

For example:

Input: 
2009

After Run Length Encoding: 
2 (2)0 9

After converting encoded series to english words (Output): 
Two Two Zeros Nine
Input
Line 1: The string containing decimal digits only.
Output
Line 1: The string of space separated words.
Constraints
No one digit repeats more than 9 times in a row in the input.
Length of the input string < 60
Example
Input
2009
Output
Two Two Zeros Nine
